Row.Text: I'm not interested in this.
Nothing happens.
Crowded Markets, Foreign Tongues

Crowds gather in your city's marketplace, voices from many different lands ringing out as deals are struck and bargains made. Some are angry about this, and believe that foreigners will destroy our trade. Others, however, encourage the foreign business, hoping to learn from their culture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How do you feel about this? Choose from the following options:
Let the foreigners continue to trade.
Market in City: +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, -1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Implement heavy taxes on imported goods.
Market in City: +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Icons of Our Past

Monuments represent the most important symbols of your culture. Your people seek to celebrate this by dedicating the City's Monument to either their ancestors, or to their gods.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How do you feel about this? Choose from the following options:
Dedicate the Monument to our ancestors.
Monument in City: +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
The gods are what is important now.
Monument in City: +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith.
Neither will suffice. The Monument should generate revenue.
Monument in City: +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Rich Vein

A rich vein of blue marble was discovered at the quarry near the city. Your miners and masons have come to you to ask you what you would like to do it.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Choose from the options below...
Boast of this, and merchants will come to buy it from us.
+{2_InstantYield}, and 10 turns of 'We Love the King Day' in the City.
Donate it to the Temple.
{2_InstantYield}.
Carve relics and idols from it.
{2_InstantYield}
Give it to our finest artists.
+2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in the City for {5_Turns}.
Old Men and the Sea.
A band of local fishermen have appealed to the City for funding for a seasonal fishing expedition.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Choose from the following options...
Let's focus on something simple.
Spend {1_Scaled}. 50% Chance to gain +75 [ICON_FOOD] Food in the City.
A large investment will pay dividends.
Spend {1_Scaled}. 50% Chance that Fishing Boats near the City will gain +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food for {5_Turns}.
I'd rather invest in real estate.
Spend {1_YieldCost}. A Lighthouse is constructed in the City.
The fishermen from {2_City} succeeded on their voyage, and have returned with a large haul of fish!{5_Help}
Fishing expedition successful!
The fishermen from {2_City} succeeded, and all Fishing Boats near {2_City} are producing +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food!{5_Help}
Fishing expedition successful!
Dramatic Masterpiece
Writers from the City have penned a new work, and critics are calling it a 'masterpiece.' News of this has reached your ear, and your advisors await your response.
Send news to the other civilizations of the world.
Pay {1_YieldCost}. Gain {2_InstantYield} Tourism with all known Civilizations.
Let's celebrate this.
Gain {2_InstantYield}.
Make sure the writers are praised for this.
Gain {4_GPChange} points in the City.
They should have been praying instead.
Gain {1_YieldCost}.
Writers from {2_City} have penned a new dramatic work, attracting visitors from around the world.
Writers from {2_CityName} create a masterpiece.
Trouble at the Temple

Priests from the City demand that you weigh in on a religious debate. As the City grows, more and more people of different faiths are asking for use of the Temple. People of the majority faith resent this, and threaten violence if you allow nonbelievers into the Temple. Nonbelievers, however, threaten to leave if you do not let them in. What will you do?
Good riddance.
-1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population in the City, and 2 turns of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance. Gain {2_InstantYield}.
Let them in, but make them pay for it.
Temple gains +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith. -1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in City.
Reject the nonbelievers.
50% chance that the Temple is destroyed. If so, the city gains +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith and +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.
The nonbelievers in {2_City} struck out at the Temple, burning it to the ground in protest. Your people are not shaken, however. City receives +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness, and: {5_Help}
Temple in {2_City} destroyed!
We should think bigger.
Pay {1_YieldCost}. The Temple is destroyed, and a Grand Temple is built in its place.
Beacon of Hope
Fishermen in the City are concerned about the fate of the City's Lighthouse. In recent years it has fallen under disrepair, and it needs to be rebuilt. How should we deal with this?
Let private citizens manage it.
Lighthouse gains +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
The city should manage it.
Lose {1_YieldCost}. The Lighthouse gains +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Sell off the land.
Gain {2_InstantYield}. The Lighthouse is destroyed.
Hospital Overcrowding

Soldiers from the front pour into this City every day, and the wards are now filled with patients. Local doctors do not know what to do with the overflow, and have petitioned your government for support. What will you do?
Send emergency funding.
For the next {5_Turns}, the City produces -5 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, but gains +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.
Triage is the only option.
Implement a triage system, saving those that we can. The City loses 1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.
This is not our problem.
City produces -1 Happiness permanently.
Set up a permanent stipend for the Hospital.
City produces -5 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, but gains +2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness permanently.
Send all deceased to our Research Lab.
50% chance that the City will experience 3 turns of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance. If so, the Hospital gains +4 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
Cadavers were delivered to our Research Lab, however the public is outraged at our callousness.
Hospital science experiments discovered!
Factory Partnership

Businessmen approach the City's government, asking for permission to begin a joint-venture with the local Factory. There are five competing partnership bids, and the City's government needs guidance. Which would you prefer?
Let's produce luxury textiles.
Factory in City: +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
Cheap textiles sound lucrative.
Factory in City: +3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Chemicals are a valuable asset
Factory in City: +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Pharmaceuticals will benefit our local scientists.
Factory in City: +2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
Canned goods will support our growing cities.
Factory in City: +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food.
Stadium Sellout!
A game was held in your stadium as part of the WSO International! You gain 500 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism with all known Civilizations, and 500 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Game Day
The City's Stadium is preparing for game day! Unfortunately, it seems the manager misplaced his schedule, and he can't remember what kind of event is happening! What's going on here, again?
A skiing competition, obviously.
Gain 400 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and 100 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
Water sports, obviously.
Gain 400 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and 250 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
Pretty sure it was football. No, the American kind.
Gain 500 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Pretty sure it was football. Yeah, the real kind.
Gain 500 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
A sporting event? No, it was a ceremony.
Gain 300 [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age Points.
Nuclear meltdown!

The worst has happened. The City's Nuclear Plant has had a meltdown, rendering vast sections of the city uninhabitable. The building is destroyed, and all other buildings in the City are at risk. The City loses 5 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.
Drought
Drought has struck the City, crippling its [ICON_FOOD] Food output. For the next {5_Turns}, Farms produce -1 [ICON_FOOD] Food.
Severe Drought
Severe drought has struck the City, crippling its [ICON_FOOD] Food output. For the next {5_Turns}, Farms produce -1 [ICON_FOOD] Food, and a nearby Farm is pillaged.
Critical Drought
Critical drought has struck the City, crippling its [ICON_FOOD] Food output. For the next {5_Turns}, Farms produce -2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, and 2 nearby Farms are pillaged.
Exposure
Sub-zero temperatures have left many people in the City at risk to exposure. -1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population in the City.
Fuel Shortage
Due to extreme cold, the City is currently experiencing a fuel shortage. Further supplies have been diverted from our industries to compensate. {1_YieldCost} towards the City's current task.
Frozen Waters
The city's river has frozen over, severely hampering commerce. -3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold in the City for {5_Turns}.
Bitter Winds
Bitterly cold winds are severely hampering production in the lands around the City. For {5_Turns}, all Quarries, Pastures, Farms, and Lumbermills produce -1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Mine Collapse
A mineshaft near the City has collapsed, killing all the workers and pillaging the Mine.
Forest Fire
Underbrush in a nearby Forest has set ablaze, forcing workers out of the Forest until the fires abate. Up to two Lumbermills near the City are pillaged.
Avalanche
Snow melt from a nearby mountain has collapsed, causing a massive avalanche. Up to two Villages and two Farms near the City are pillaged.
Local Corruption
Administrators in this City are currently facing charges of corruption. The people are angry, and demand some semblance of justice. A scapegoat is needed. Who will you blame?
The Minister of Agriculture is to blame.
{3_CityYield} in the City for {5_Turns}.
I knew the Corp of Engineers was up to no good.
{3_CityYield} in the City for {5_Turns}.
Someone's been stealing money from the treasury?
{3_CityYield} in the City for {5_Turns}.
I'll take the blame, I guess.
-2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in the City for {5_Turns}.
Spoiled Food
A large portion of food in the Granary spoiled, no doubt due to mismanagement. {1_YieldCost} in the City.
Bandits!
Bandits assaulted your tax collectors, making off with the money! {1_YieldCost}.
Great Harvest
Farmers in the City report an excellent harvest this season. +{2_InstantYield} in the City.
Market Day
Market Day has begun, and the City's marketplace is filled with customers. For the next {5_Turns}, the City's Market produces +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Eruption!

Oh no! A once-dormant mountain near the City has suddenly erupted, pouring down lava into the City and the surrounding countryside! Effects: -3 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population in the City, multiple Improvements are pillaged, and many City buildings are damaged!
Krakatoa Erupts!

Krakatoa has erupted! Massive plumes of ash, smoke, and lava have enveloped the nearby City and its countryside. Effects: -3 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population, Improvements are pillaged, and many Buildings are damaged!
Resort near Natural Wonder
As a result of the tourism generated by a nearby Natural Wonder, a business consortium decided to construct a Hotel in this City.
School Board Established

A school board was recently established in the City, and they seek to reform the City's Public School. They look to you for guidance: would you prefer free tuition for all students in the City, or would you rather privatize the institution?
Education should be free for everyone.
Public School: +10% [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in the City.
Education should be available to those who can afford it.
Public School: +10% [ICON_GOLD] Gold in the City.
Pestilence
A blight has devestated the farmland near this City. Up to two Farms near the City are pillaged.
Floods
The City's river has flooded, devastating the nearby farmland and damaging the City's buildings. Up to 3 Farms are pillaged, and some buildings may be destroyed as well.
Hurricane approaches

A hurricane looms on the horizon, and is headed straight for the City. It may or may not hit the city. If it does, expect major losses of life and property. The City's council is unsure of how to respond, and looks to you for guidance.
Evacuate the City and sandbag everything.
Lose 1000 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. The City is well-prepared for the hurricane.
Buckle down and hope for the best. There's nothing we can do.
No preparation. Good luck!
Send in the military to protect property.
Lose 500 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. If the hurricane hits, expect large losses of life.
Send in the military to protect the populace.
Lose 500 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. If the hurricane hits, expect major property damage.
Our river's levee will protect us from surge water!
Lose 500 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and rely on the river's levee. If the hurricane hits, expect major property damage.
Hurricane strikes {2_City}!
A Hurricane struck {2_City}, dealing major damage. Thankfully, the City was well-prepared, and was minimally damaged.
A Hurricane struck {2_City}, dealing major damage. The City was not well-prepared, and was horribly damaged.
A Hurricane struck {2_City}, dealing major damage. The City itself was well-protected, but the population suffers.
A Hurricane struck {2_City}, dealing major damage. The City's population was well-protected, but the City itself was decimated.
A Hurricane struck {2_City}, dealing major damage. The City's levee did not hold, and the City was devastated.
Plague!
Our worst fears have come true. Plague has reached the City! People lay dead in the streets, and hundreds more die every day. Effect: -15 [ICON_FOOD] Food in the City for {5_Turns}.
Mysterious Wanderer

A cloaked figure lingers outside the City's Walls. When asked why he has come to the city, he hands the guard a tattered letter:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I am a man of many talents, but I have no home. Mute since birth, I teach and train without words. I can offer you one of four talents in exchange for hospitality and a home."
"The gift of the artist."
Gain {4_GPChange} in the City.
"The gift of the craftsman."
Gain {4_GPChange} in the City.
"The gift of the soothsayer."
Gain {4_GPChange} in the City.
"The gift of the trader."
Gain {4_GPChange} in the City.
Nomadic Incursion

A group of nomadic peoples have appeared at your borders, and petition for the right to settle in your territory. They seem friendly, and are willing to negotiate in order to gain what they desire. How do you respond?
Give them land, but only if they adapt to our culture.
Gain {2_Instant} towards Border Growth in this City (only affects Border Growth).
Drive them out, and steal whatever we can take.
Receive {1_Cost}. 50% chance that two Barbarian units will spawn near the City.
Invite them to settle, but only if their finest soldiers join our army.
A free military Unit spawns near your City.
Invite them to integrate into the City, so that we may learn of their culture.
City gains 1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizen. +{4_GPChange} in the City.
Your brazen actions angered the nomads, and they have declared war on you! Two Barbarian units spawn near {2_City}.
Nomadic retaliation against {2_City}!
{1_Playername} discovered an arms smuggling operation!
{1_Playername} raided an arms shipment of [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron passing through their territory. In other news, a fire has left dozens dead at a recent political summet.
{1_Playername} recruits financial experts from a City State!
{1_Playername} has secured backing from a well placed political faction.
{1_Playername} moves againt organised-crime syndicates.
Rumours suggest that {1_Playername} has more knowledge about goings on within their Empire than first thought!
{1_Playername} displays heightened levels of military intelligence.
Rumours suggest that {1_Playername} has more knowledge about other Empires' military movements than they should!
War Materials

Our agents have estabilished comprehensive links within a dissident City-State faction. They have leaked us intelligence of an arms smuggling operation occuring in our territory at this very moment![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How should we act on this?
Gain +2 [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron and {2_InstantYield}.
Gain an Envoy in each city.
Your Chanceries increase [ICON_GOLD] Gold production in cities by 5%.
Your eligible Military Units gain the Ambush I promotion.
Sieze the shipment when it reaches the border. We cannot guarantee anyone's safety at such short notice.
Our contacts must be desperate. Under the guise of recruiting financial experts, send our Foreign Advisor to negotiate for their remaining political links.
Small arms deals do not interest me. However, the extent of this infiltration is astouding. Exfiltrate these agents and give them their own agency. Let's call it CI:5.
Small arms deals do not interest me. However, the field skills detailed in this report are second to none. Exfiltrate these agents and send them to the new military intelligence branch, CI:6.
{1_Playername}'s Palace has been blown up by religious dissidents!
Their capital has entered [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance.
Gunpowder Plot

A man of a minority faith has come forward, confessing his involvement in a plot to blow up the Palace. He begs for repentence, but doesn't know enough to bring down the plotters.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]What should we do, Your Excellence?
50% chance for {5_Turns} turns of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance.
Convert 60% of followers to your Religion, but lose -2 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.
2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness for 15 turns.
Spend {2_InstantYield} in return for +2 [ICON_PEACE] Faith, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture on the Palace.

If anything happens to that building, the only thing that will be different, the only thing that will change, the only difference that it will make, is that next turn instead of a notification, I will be reading your resignation!
Offer this man, and any others who want to come forward, a pardon. Then, burn every remaining member of that misbegotten faith at the stake.
Those ungrateful muts. Pull every reserve to search for these conspirators. Double the guard. Cancel Christmas.
Clean out the palace. When the explosion comes, tell everyone it was part of the WTLKD celebrations. Then, build a bigger, better Palace.
Notorious Pirate
A notorious pirate is known to spend his time ashore in one of our Harbor's taverns. His presence is attracting a slew of undiserables.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]So far, no one has been able to catch him.
Certainly no pirate I've ever heard of. Send some Navy official to deal with this, what's the worse that could happen?
I've heard much of this sailor's exploits. Send an agent to present him with this letter of marque.
Though the local fishermen may not like it, I can see the benefits of having a legendary tavern.
They say this man hordes his fortune in a rare type of Pearl. It would be unfortunate if someone were to... commandeer it.
20% chance for the one turn of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Rioting and the destruction of the Harbor.
Spend 400 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to gain a Corvette.
The Harbor gains +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +2 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism, but nearby Fishing Boats lose -1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and -1 [ICON_FOOD] Food.
Up to 2 Fishing Boats and the Harbor are destroyed. A [ICON_WAR] Barbarian Unit spawns. Gain a copy of the [ICON_RES_PEARLS] Pearls resource.
{1_Playername} extends hand to foreign dissidents.
{1_Playername} gains additional cultural and diplomatic influence.
Rumours circulate that {1_Playername} is funding terrorist organisations!
Autocracy and Order Empires are now vulnerable to partisan attacks on their Occupied Cities.
Alliance of the Free

Your recent backing of Covert Operations has led to several competing teams within CI:7. Each has a different idea of how the additional funding should be spent.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]What is your verdict?
Gain +4 [ICON_RES_PAPER] Paper. Airports increase [ICON_CULTURE] Culture output in cities by 5%.
The [ICON_OCCUPIED] Occupied Cities of other Ideologies are vulnerable to partisan attacks.
Reduce the [ICON_GOLD] Poverty and [ICON_RESEARCH] Illiteracy thresholds in all cities by 15%.
I like Operation Golden Door. We will defeat our enemies with the strength of our conviction and purity of our ideology.
I like Operation Pincushion. We will give those who yearn for Freedom the weapons with which to do so.
I like Operation Illuminatus. Sometimes, to remain free, we must do things against our own moral code. The happy populus, not burdened as we who must lead, cannot be allowed to naively interfere.
A rebel uprising has ignited in the City of {2_CityName}.
Two [ICON_WAR] Barbarian units have spawned near {2_CityName}.
Partisan Uprising
Surprisingly well-armed dissidents have to the streets of our City, protesting the Occupation. Those filthy Capitalists are behind this, mark my words.

Surprisingly well-armed dissidents have to the streets of our City, protesting the Occupation. Those filthy Capitalists are behind this, mark my words.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Two [ICON_WAR] Barbarian units spawn.
A rebel uprising has ignited in the City of {2_CityName}.
Two [ICON_WAR] Barbarian units have spawned near {2_CityName}.
Partisan Uprising
Surprisingly well-armed dissidents have to the streets of our City. Those filthy Capitalists are behind this, mark my words.

Surprisingly well-armed dissidents have to the streets of our City, protesting the Occupation. Those filthy Capitalists are behind this, mark my words.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Two [ICON_WAR] Barbarian units spawn.
Black Market
The authorities have intercepted a small scale operation smuggling contraband into the city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Governor thinks they might be of use...
Gain {2_InstantYield}.
Lose {2_InstantYield} Golden Age Points. The threshold for [ICON_STRENGTH] Crime is permentantly reduced by 10%.
The Constabulary gains +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Gain 10 turns of WLTKD in the city.
No deals. The law is clear on their punishment.
Talk of corruption in my very presence?! I am the law. Find me a new Governor, and hang the old one beside these criminals.
I agree. There will always be crime; it would be useful to have friends on the other side of the law.
Banning these goods is, I think, a little old-fashioned. Pardon the smugglers and legalise these products.
Motaba Virus

Our military intelligence has brought in a babbling medic, who claims to have discovered an incredibly dangerous virus while doing charity work in one of the far-flung corners of the world.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Only this man's research need make it to our Science Advisor...
Enemy cities experience biological terrorism.
Gain {2_InstantYield}. Your cities become immune to biological terrorism.
Gain 2 Guided Missiles in every city.
Your Aircraft gain the Air Siege III promotion.
Get me the head of CI:6. I'm authorising the use of this virus against civilian populations.
What are you talking about?! This is horrifying. Send the Doctor to our best Medical Lab, we need to be prepared should this thing ever break loose!
This is just what the boys over at prototype weapons have been looking for. Green light the Scud Storm project.
We can't trust something like this to those nutjobs over in RnD. Get me the Airforce.
The City of {2_CityName} has succumbed to an horrific viral outbreak.
The [ICON_CITIZEN] Population of {2_CityName} has fallen by 5!
The City of {2_CityName} is fighting an horrific viral outbreak.
The City of {2_CityName} has lost 5 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population, but a cure has been discovered!
Viral Outbreak
The city has been gripped by the deadly Motaba virus. At this time, there is no available treatment. We must prepare for the worst.
Lose 5 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.
Lose 5 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population and 2000 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, but become immune to such events in the future.
Quarantine is the only option we have available.
Give the Medical Lab anything they need. We need to have an answer before this thing strikes again.
{1_Playername} has abducted a foreign citizen.
{1_Playername} gained a [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Person.
They Know We Know They Know...
An agent we planted in a foreign intelligence agency believes she is being fed false information.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How should we instruct her to continue?
Gain the Covert Action Policy for {4_Turns}.
Wire Service increase [ICON_RESEARCH] Science in Cities by 10%.
Lose 500 [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age points in exchange for a Great Person.
Let them doctor their schematics; meanwhile we will put more people inside their Covert Action scheme.
Bug everything. We need to know what they are up to at all times!
We can't risk corrupted information. The next high profile target our asset gets near is coming back with her to the Motherland.
A report has shown that the recently-constructed trans-continental pipeline was built with major structural flaws.
All [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil Wells are vulnerable to malfunction while an investigation takes place.
In the Pipeline
One of our operatives has attained a high ranking position in a foreign Oil company.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How should we use our asset?
Gain +4 [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil. Customs Houses increase [ICON_GOLD] Gold in Cities by 10%.
Temporarily, Foreign [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil resources will be likely to explode.
Gain the Refridgeration technology.
With influence over trading, we should be able to make sure some of that [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil finds its way to our ports.
The asset is well-placed to conduct a strategic piece of industrial espionage.
His report details plans for the construction of large off-shore platforms. Get me those schematics!
The City of {2_CityName}'s Oil Wells have malfunctioned.
An Oil Well has exploded!
Explosion at the Oil Field
An [ICON_RES_OIL] Oil Well is destroyed.
Art Forgery

New, 'non-destructive' analysis is all the rage in our galleries. Unfortunately, our Cultural Advisor believes at least one of our paintings is, in fact, a fake.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]They are going to find out...
Spend {2_InstantYield} to gain the same amount of [ICON_GREAT_ARTIST] Great Artist points.
Lose {2_InstantYield} Culture.
Gain a copy of the [ICON_RES_GLASS] Glass resource.
We must protect the reputation of our Artists. Pay off whoever you need to.
Oh well. Isn't all Art a lie?
Fortunately, a City State Museum has been after that painting for ages. Tell them they can have it for that one stained-glass statue I like.
